pathAssistantSteps.info:
AWESOME! Welcome to a few last considerations:

  • Always wait until after an offer to give references.
  • Any personal info entered into HireRight or another background checking company must be saved for your future reference.
  • Make sure any criminal background is reported before a background check is done.
  • If you were caught with marijuana 20 years ago as a teenager, and forget to say something, the offer might be rescinded.
  • Sometimes a company will rescind the offer if the budget shrinks or a better candidate appears at the last moment.
  • Keep applying to other jobs!

Great work reaching the hiring manager!

  • Sometimes this stage is similar to the recruiter discussion.
  • The hiring manager is seeing if you are human, normal, and manageable.
  • They do not want to be managing someone odd.
  • The hiring manager often gives a quick pass off to the technical & cultural stage.
  • Sometimes you never meet the hiring manager until after the technical interviews.
  • Sometimes the hiring manager gives the technical & cultural interview.
  • Sometime the hiring manager will hire you after one interview.

Keep your cool and never appear desperate:

  • Always appear fully employed.
  • Tell them you need to give two weeks notice or indicate you have responsibilities you need to wrap-up.
  • Demonstrate commitment and respect for the job you are leaving.
  • Once you pass the background check and land the job, you are often able to create a grace period between jobs.
  • Try to practice Bodhicitta and prepare for your next role if you are afforded a one or two week break.

Maintain personal power with recruiters:

  • Do not give personal references until after an offer.
  • Avoid jumping through hoops for them.
  • Recruiters will drain you if you let them.
  • Set clear boundaries, expectations, and get to the next stage as quickly as possible.
  • You may go through two recruiters at a recruiting firm and one at the hiring company before reaching the next stage.

Great job, keep submitting!

  • After your application is received, your journey has just begun.
  • The upcoming stages are often far different than reality.
  • These stages do provide you a basic framework for what to expect.

You are almost there! Expect variation during the following stage:

  • Developers expect 3 independent 1 hour technical/cultural interviews.
  • The 3 sessions are usually done by 3 different people.
  • Often your future teammates do these interviews.
  • Afterwards the 3 people will meet with the hiring manager to make a decision.
  • For non-technical roles there is a similar process.
  • Technical roles may have a take home challenge.
  • You might skip this stage and have a couple friendly meetings with future teammates if the hiring manager wants you hired immediately.
